description: From piss +‎ bed, so called after the dandelion's supposed diuretic effect. Compare French pissenlit.

entries.meaning: The dandelion, formerly much used for its diuretic properties. [from 16th c.]
examples: The tufted hillock […] had no buildings on and only golden clumps of piss-the-bed that were not yet gone into misty balls of seed.

entries.meaning: (dialect) Any of various other wild plants with diuretic properties; bluet, oxeye daisy, etc.
